title: Course objectives
text:
Be able to:

Develop the SuSo app
Prepare the server
Create assignments
Prepare devices
Train interviewers
Manage data collection

title: Survey Solutions’ components
text:
Know the component pieces of the Survey Solutions suite
Know which component does what

title: Survey Solutions’ components
text:
Answer these questions

Name the components

What are the component packages of the Survey Solutions suite?



Designing questionnaires

Which component is the main one used for designing a questionnaire?
Are there any others? If so, which one(s)?



Managing data collection

Which software is the main one used to manage data collection?
Are there any others? If so, which one(s)?

Assignment
Follow the instructions here in order to:

Get comforable with Slack

title: Course overview
text:
Resources

 Using slides
See more here.


 Using Slack
Even if Slack may not be familiar, it’s easy to use.
To get started:

Join the training work group. Look for an invitation in your email.
Follow the getting started guide. Read this short step-by-step guide. Watch this. And enjoy messaging within our training team–ideally, chatting in public channels or, if needed, pinging people privately.

Questionnaire title. Display name of questionnaire (e.g., Zimbabwe PICES 2023)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:

Compose email or user name associated with Survey Solutions account.
Click INVITE to grant the specified access and have Survey Solutions send an invitation email.

title: Create a basic questionnaire
text:
Create a basic questionnaire
Start a working draft of the PICES housing module

title: Create a basic questionnaire
text:
1. Create a questionnaire

Navigate to Designer
Create a new questionnaire. For a reminder how, see here.
Give it an appropriate questionnaire title and questionnaire variable, given that it will contain the PICES housing module

title: Create a basic questionnaire
text:
2. Review and plan

Review draft PICES housing module
Identify an appropriate question type for each question in the module. Consult these slides and these resources as useful.
Compile questions/notes to discuss–either on Slack or during the next session.

title: Create a basic questionnaire
text:
3. Develop

Review the video here.
Create one (or more) question in Designer per question in Excel.
Be sure to copy-paste from Excel to Designer in order to minimize the tedium

title: Create a basic questionnaire
text:
4. Test

Review the video here
Test as you develop
Correct your design in order to acheive the desired result.

title: Create groups
text:
Create sections and populate them with questions
Create sub-sections and move questions into them

title: Create groups
text:
1. Create a housing section

Create a new section to contain the housing module you developed last week.
Give it an appropriate title
Add an appropriate emoji (e.g., 🏡). If useful, search for emojis here.

title: Create groups
text:
2. Move housing content into it
Move each question from its current question to the newly created section.
This may seem inefficient because one could always rename the current section, but this is for practice.

title: Create groups
text:
3. Create thematic sub-sections
Create the following sub-sections:

Construction materials: questions 3-5
Access to electricity: questions 8-13
Sources of energy: 14-15
Sources of water and sanitation: 16-35

Move questions into them.

title: Creating groups (of questions)
text:
Create groups of questions
Move questions–both within and across groups

title: Creating groups (of questions)
text: Slides

title: Creating groups (of questions)
text:
Assignment
Move the housing module questions both into a new section and into sub-sections within that section. See here.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Roster source
What it is
Type of quetion for roster source
What it does

Filters to questions of designated type (e.g., list, multi-select yes/no)
Permits easier selection of soure question

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Roster ID
What it is
Variable name for the roster
What it does

Allows references to roster in conditions
Provides name for roster in data export

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Roster name
What it is
Template for text on roster row buttons
What it does
Determines what appears on roster row buttons

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Source question
What it is
Question that defines a roster.
What it does
Defines:

Number of rows (e.g., household members)
Content of row titles (e.g., names of members)

Example 1: household composition








Typical PAPI process

Capture basic info on all members
Capture detailed info

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Example 1: household composition








CAPI design

Create two rosters

Different object
Different roster ID

But each roster points to same source
Place one part in one section
Place other part in another section

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Example 2: education


Video


All member-level rosters are continuation of household composition
May filter to subset of members (e.g., age > 3)
But all member-level rosters

Carry forward members from household compostion
Include IDs of those members

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Example 2: education


Video


Create education roster in new section

Different object
Different roster ID

But both rosters points to same source

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Summary

Each roster must have a unique name, but may share the same source
All rosters with the same source question are considered the same roster

Variables exist in same context
Data export in the same file

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Example 1: Parcel-plot roster









Parcels may contain 1 or more plots
Parcels are areas with the same management
Plots are areas with the same cropping pattern

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Example 2: Parcel-plot-crop roster









Parcels may contain 1 or more plots
Plots may have 1 or more crops planted on it

text:

Create a first roster in a section
Create a continuation of that roster in another section
Create a new roster inside of the continued roster

title: Learning Survey Solutions

Roster that:

Results from more than 1 round of enumerating things
Contains row IDs for each round of enumeration

title: Create basic rosters
text:
Understand how to create basic rosters
Build two basic rosters that provide a template for many other rosters in PICES

title: Create basic rosters
text:
1. Create a household roster

Review the household roster on page 4 of the 2017 APM questionnaire here
Create a source question
Create a roster that uses that source question
Add questions to that roster

title: Create basic rosters
text:
2. Create durables roster

Review the durables roster in the 2023 PICES questionnaire
Create a source question
Create a roster that uses that source question
Add questions to that roster

title: Create complex rosters
text:
Understand how to create complex rosters
Build two complex rosters that provide a template for many other rosters in PICES

title: Create complex rosters
text:
1. Modify the household roster

Review the household roster on page 4 of the 2017 APM questionnaire here.
Assume that this roster should be administered in two parts:

First, ask questions 2 and 3 for all members
Then, ask questions 4-6

Consider modifying the roster created in the previous assignment rather than creating a new roster.

title: Create complex rosters
text:
2. Create a parcel-plot roster

Review the parcel and plot rosters here.
For the parcel roster:

Review pages 9 and 7 of the 2017 APM questionnaire
Use the parcel flap on page 9 and questions 3, 4, and 6 on page 7

For the plot roster:

Review pages 24 and 10 of the 2017 APM questionnaire
Use the plot flap on page 24 and questions 1 and 2 on page 10

Condition
// no more than 2 sessions are possible
self <= 2
Behavior

Depends on a logical condition
If true, valid answer -> nothing happens
If false, invalide answer -> message and change in UI
(If no condition, valid by default)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
section: How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps
text:
How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps


// no more than 2 sessions are possible
self <= 2


Describe valid answers. Not invalid answers. Think assert in Stata.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
section: How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps
text:
How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps









Describe valid answers. Not invalid answers. Think assert in Stata.
No need to search for message. Messages are local to validations, not global to the application.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
section: How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps
text:
How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps




Video




Describe valid answers. Not invalid answers. Think assert in Stata.
No need to search for message. Messages are local to validations, not global to the application.
Impossible to block invalid answers. Design choice to allow invalid answers and not block fieldwork/data entry. No equivalent of CSPro’s reenter. But other mechanisms for dealing with invalid answers.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Basic operators1


Relational

Equal: ==
Not-equal: !=
And the rest: >, >=, <=, <



Logical

And: &&
Or: ||
Not: !



Mathematical

Add: +
Subtract: -
Multiply: *
Divide: %



See more here. For example, the ternary operator is quite useful.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Comments


Inline
// this is a comment
x == 1


Block
/* 
this
is a block
comment
*/

x == 1


Both
/* 
this
is a block
comment
*/

// voici un autre commentaire
x == 1

Relational

q14 == 96

InRange








// administer B20 when the household member is married (i.e., answer 1 or 2 to B19)
hh_b19.InRange(1,2)

// enable question 6 when answer is 1, 4, or 5 is chosen for question 4
ag_q4.InList(1,4,5)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Categorical: single-select
IsNoneOf









With InRange, identify those values that enable F13
// enable F13 if one of these answers selected for F12
hh_f12.InRange(3,10)


With IsNoneOf, identify those values that do NOT enable F13
// enable F13 if no firewood option is chosen for F12
hh_f12.IsNoneOf(1,2)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
Learning Survey Solutions
text:
What is a variable
A few complementary explanations:

Question answered by a computer rather than interviewer
Object whose value is evaluated by an expression

Static expression (e.g., a fixed string value that depends on nothing)
Dynamic expression (e.g., a computation whose values derives from one or more question)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Why use a variable
Many potential reasons:

Computer can answer questions more reliably than a person (e.g., ENUMERATOR: CHECK...)
Value of an expression needs to be saved (e.g., randomization)
Value of an expression is used in other expressions

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
How to create a variable




Video






Create a variable


Click on ADD VARIABLE button or
Right-click and select Add variable after




Select the (data) type


Boolean
Double
Date/Time
Long integer
String


Give the usual attributes

Variable name
Variable label

Define its value with an expression that yield a value of the expected data type
(Optionally) Select whether not to export (default: export)

Introduction to conditions
section: 1. Add conditions to the housing module
text:
1. Add conditions to the housing module

Add enablement conditions to implement the skips on paper
Add validations, if relevant

For reference, the draft housing module can be found here.

title: Introduction to conditions
text:
2. Review the conditions app
To get feel for how conditions work for a broader set of question:

Create your own copy of the public Conditions questionnaire here.
In one browser tab, test the app in one browser tab
In another browser tab, meanwhile, inspect the enablement and validation conditions

title: Introduction to conditions
section: 2. Read the documentation other useful question (data) types
text:
2. Read the documentation other useful question (data) types
To develop a deeper understanding of conditions for types likely useful for HBS, read the documentation below and try to adapt the examples to HBS:

Multi-select questions
Numeric
Text
List

title: Introduction to conditions
text:
Get a practical overview of conditions–what they are, what they do, where to use them
Learn the basics of condition syntax
Learn conditions for single-select categorical questions–the most common use case
Learn where to find more for conditions involving other question (data) types
Learn about variables

title: Introduction to conditions
text: Slides

title: Introduction to conditions
text:
Assignment
Complete the assignment here.
This will provide an opportunity to:

Implement conditions on the housing module
Explore conditions for other question (data) types

title: Introduction to conditions
text:
Resources

C# data types for SuSo questions. Often, it’s useful to understand how SuSo stores/represents answers to its questions. With this knowledge, users can identify C# resources for accomplishing something (e.g., C# documentation, StackOverflow articles, etc.).
Conditions public app. Even though it’s already part of the assignment above, it’s truly worth reviewing to develop familiarity with the conditions for a broader set of question (data) typess.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
General syntax
name_of_roster.Query(x=>x.var_to_query==1)






  
  
    
      Item
      Explanation
    
  
  
    name_of_roster
Name of the collection to query
    Query
Query operator
    x
Anonymous variable that captures the queried content
    x.var_to_query
Query variable(s); instance of that (those) variable(s)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Common queries

All

Explanation: All elements of the collection meet the query criteria
Result: true/false.

Any

Explanation: At least one element of the collection meets the query criteria.
Result: true/false.

Count

Explanation. Count the number of elements that meet the criteria
Result. Count.

FirstOrDefault

Explanation: Find the first element that meets the criteria.
Result: First element found or default (null)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Color

HowKey wordsRecall periodChanging wordsCombinations




<font color = "blue">Blue</font>
<font color = "#e33d30">Red<font>

Blue Red






Question

WHAT IS THE MAIN MATERIAL USED FOR THE HOUSE FLOOR?


Markup

WHAT IS THE <font color="blue">MAIN MATERIAL</font> USED FOR THE HOUSE <font color="blue">FLOOR</font>?


Result

WHAT IS THE MAIN MATERIAL USED FOR THE HOUSE FLOOR?







Question

During the past 7 days, did members of your household consume [ITEM] within the household?


Markup

During the <font color = "green">past 7 days</font>, did members of your household consume [ITEM] within the household?


Result

During the past 7 days, did members of your household consume [ITEM] within the household?







Question

During the past 7 days, did members of your household consume [ITEM] within the household?


Markup

During the past 7 days, did members of your household consume <font color="blue">[ITEM]</font> within the household?


Result

During the past 7 days, did members of your household consume [ITEM] within the household?







Question

During the past 7 days, did members of your household consume ITEM within the household?


Markup

During the <font color = "green">past 7 days</font>, did members of your household consume <font color="red">[ITEM]</font> within the household?


Result

During the past 7 days, did members of your household consume [ITEM] within the household?

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Spacing HowUnits/instructionsLong text Line breaks This is some text

SOME TEXT AFTER A SPACE Result This is some text SOME TEXT AFTER A SPACE Paragraphs

This is some paragraph text

SOME TEST AFTER A SPACE

Results This is some paragraph text SOME TEST AFTER A SPACE What is [NAME]’s father’s main occupation ? DESCRIBE IN A FEW WORDS E.G. PRIMARY SCHOOL TEACHER, BRICK LAYER, ETC. What is [NAME]'s father’s main occupation ?

DESCRIBE IN A FEW WORDS E.G. PRIMARY SCHOOL TEACHER, BRICK LAYER, ETC. Did your household purchase materials with the intention of undertaking the maintenance or repair of the household itself in the past 12 months? Consider activities of repair and maintanance that have to be undertaken regularly in order to maintain the dwelling in good working order, that do not change the dwelling’s performance, capacity or expected service life and that, as such, are normally carried out by both owner occupiers and tenants

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text: Radio buttons v. combo box

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Radio buttons too long




Video




Too many options
Occupy most/all of a screen
Easier to search by typing than scrolling

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Combo box too limiting




Video




Interviewers don’t know list
Interviewers don’t know to search
Only see first 20 options

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
When to use


Radio buttons

Less than 10 answer options
Answer list to be read aloud
Answer list not known / not amenable to search by typing


Combo box

More than 10 answer options
Interviewer knows that searching to be done
Answer list known / amenable to typing

title: Design for UX/survey protocol
text:
0. Update the durables module
In the basic rosters assignment, you created an asset roster. In this assignment, make changes to that application to reflect what you’ve learned in this lesson/.

title: Design for UX/survey protocol
text:
1. Add colors

Identify the key parts of questions
Apply color to the text with HTML tags

title: Design for UX/survey protocol
text:
2. Add spaces

Identify questions with notes at the bottom of the question text (e.g., NUMBER OF ITEMS, VALUE, NUMBER OF YEARS, etc.)
Add space between the main question text and these notes using HTML tags

title: Design for UX/survey protocol
section: 3. Change design to align with survey protocol
text:
3. Change design to align with survey protocol

Notice that this section (implicitly) expects that question 1 (whether ITEM is owned) is meant to be asked for all items before detailed quesstions are asked about owned items (i.e., questions 2-7)
Create 1 section for the question 1
Create another section for the assets roster

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Basic workflow









Create one template per target translation
Send spreadsheet to translator
Provide instructions on what not to change
Import completed translation

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Better workflow









Download translation template
Create one column per target language
Upload spreadsheet to file sharing service (e.g., Google Drive, Microsoft 365, OneDrive, Dropbox, etc.)
Provide translators access to edit that document
Provide comments and track status
Convert into one translation file per target language
Import completed translation
